Reviews.Title: Great value for the price
Reviews.Author: J. Wilson
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research on digital cameras before settling on this one.  I couldn't afford much more than $100, and yet I wanted 10mpx, low noise, long battery life, and good color reproduction and sharpness.  This samsung kept recurring in all my queries, and after checking it out, I took a chance that low price didn't always mean low quality--and this time I was very lucky.  This is a great camera:  easy to learn, easy to use, small enough to easily fit in a purse, yet large enough to fit a man's hand without slipping out accidentally.  And I'm very impressed with the quality photos it shoots.  I would have liked more manual control, but that would be in another market niche--and this was a unit purchased with my wife in mind.  Highly recommend it for people looking for an inexpensive camera which is simple to use, and yet shoots very good photos.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: S. Daugherty "Sarah"
Reviews.Content: I have really enjoyed this camera for the couple months I have had it.  We upgraded from another Samsung camera we have had for about 5 years and loved.  I chose this one because I wanted the 5x zoom and we won't be blowing our pictures up, so I didn't need the 12mp.  It takes beautiful shots, nice and clear with great color.  It also takes suprisingly good video for what it is.  You'll need a decent sized SD card for the video, though!The smart mode is good, but sometimes takes a really long time to take the picture.  I have missed a couple of awesome shots of my son (he's 2) because of how long it took to snap the pic.  I use the auto or P mode most often now to avoid some of that.Overall, I highly recommend this little camera.  It's been a vast improvement over our old one and we will hopefully have it for a long time!

Reviews.Title: Sumsung SL420
Reviews.Author: D. Keene
Reviews.Content: Pictures and videos have amazing quality. Takes pictures fast and ready to shoot again. The AUTO balance is almost always pirfect. One of the greatest features - can zoom during shooting the video (most of the cameras can't do it).BUT I was really disappointed when I ran out of memory very quick, because the video was very heavy on megabites - for 2 Gigs it could only record 12 min of video. The pics were ok - the same 3 Megs. So this camera would be perfect for someone who wants to use video just occasionaly and not a lot. Or get 8 or 16 Gig Memory card with it, it would give you about 1-2 hours of video.

Reviews.Title: Novist Review
Reviews.Author: DML
Reviews.Content: This is my first camera ever. I am a novist who learned all this stuff in my research. I spent 2-3 weeks researching cameras. Everyone (my father, friends, co-workers **one girls father is a professional photographer**) told me a Canon was the way to go for its "HIGH" quality and durability. But all my research came back with poor to questionable customer reviews, both on and off Amazon. I also looked at the Fuji, Olympus, Panasonic, Sony, and a few more. Except for ONE Fuji camera (might have been the Fujifilm FinePix J150 or Fujifilm FinePix Z200fd **I forget**), they all had problems. After teaching myself about cameras, I learned that for a point and shoot camera there are 5 things I wanted: Small (so it can fit into my pocket and not be bulky), great to excellent picture quality/clarity, a decent zoom (3x-5x, but preferably nothing less than 4x), quick shots (so that if I am shooting something that moves, its not gone by the time the picture is taken), and very small delays between the ability to take the next picture. Sounds simple enough, right? WRONG! All the camera's in the $100-$300 range (especially the 12MP ones) had problems in many of these categories. Even some of the newest and highly boasted Canon cameras had especially poor picture quality and took up to 7 seconds to snap a photo! I read about frequent camera users who were so disappointed with their Canon PowerShot SD1300IS or Canon PowerShot SD780IS that they reverted back to their older, out dated Canon!Now, all hail the Samsung SL420!!! I can fit it in the same pocket as my cell phone which is about the same size but a little thinner. If I wanted to, I could even stuff in my iPod Touch and keys. The picture clarity is wonderful. I can see ALL the details. It has a 5x zoom (at very good quality), which beats out the best Canon's below $200 (they are usually 3x or 4x zoom). It takes quick shots so I can catch things that move (yesterday I caught a robin walking in central park). And the delays between shots is 2-3 seconds AT MOST.Added BONUSES: The camera is well constructed and I don't expect it to break on impact (sorry, but I wont be testing this out for you). Samsung (although not known for cameras) is still a quality name in electronics. Considering that this is a camera and not a video recorder, you can still shoot video with fantastic quality, and yes you can zoom in and out while using the video function. The camera is so easy to use. I read about people giving this camera to their elderly, technologically deficient parents, and it really is as simple to use as they say. I haven't changed a single setting. The camera's Smart photo technology automatically selects the best settings for the environment your in. I can even get great pictures in the pitch black dark (excellent flash). The charger cord is short (about 1.5ft), but you can leave the rechargeable battery in the camera. You just attach one end of the cord into the available slot in the camera and the other end of the cord into your computer (USB port) OR the convertible wall charger that comes with the camera. However, you cant download pictures using this cord. All of this by the way for the low, low price of $120, far cheaper than the `finest' Canon camera's. I will note right now that the reason why I didn't go for the previously mentioned Fuji camera is because it was about $30 more expensive, had fewer customer reviews (so it was more difficult to verify its quality), and I liked the Samsung brand better. On the downside, the camera does not come with its own memory card (you will have to buy this separately), but I read it can take exactly 2 photo's without one.Two more things to note for novists: First, a camera's megapixel (MP) capacity determines how high the quality for the photo will be. Also, the more MP, the larger your photo's can be when developed. Think of your flat screen TV. Those are usually rated these days using 720MP or 1080MP. Many people out there are all about the 12MP camera technology, which is why they wouldn't even look at this 10MP Samsung camera. I say, get over yourself. For the most part, the ONLY benefit of 12MP technology is turning a photo into a giant poster. Otherwise (and I spoke to a few people at Target, Best Buy, Radio Shack, and Kmart about this), if you have no intentions of hanging posters of yourself on your wall, then any camera that does 8MP or greater is MORE THAN suitable for taking high quality photos that can fit large picture frames. Remember, people have been taking wonderful pictures without 12MP technology for decades. You don't need it. Second, for my memory card I got the SanDisk Extreme III 4 GB Class 6 SDHC Flash Memory Card SDSDRX3-4096-A21. My research indicated that fast memory cards are important to decrease the shot time between photos because of the time (transfer rate) it takes for the camera to save the picture onto the memory card. I also read that it decreases the download time of photos onto your computer, but this wasn't important to me. Regardless, I decided that I would not want to ruin this fast shot camera by giving it a poor, slow memory card. A Class 6 (that's suppose to indicate its speed) memory card is the best you can get right now. I also read that with 4GB  (there is an equivalent 8GB and maybe 16GB) you can shoot around 800-1000+ photos or about 10-12+ minutes of video (you should do more research on its video capacity if this is important to you). This is more than enough space for my purposes and the Amazon price of $24 is a better price than other web site or store offers (I have no affiliation with Amazon. I'm just telling you how it is to help you out.). As expected, the memory card has worked wonderfully.

Reviews.Title: I'm very pleased
Reviews.Author: R. M. Elder
Reviews.Content: I have a 10 megapixel SLR (major brand) but wanted a small camera to carry in my pocket, that was inexpensive, and  would produce satisfying images.  I took a chance on this one and am astounded at the quality of the images it produces.  It's not quite as capable as a full scale DSLR and has the annnoying shutter lag of this type of camera, but it's quick in good light.  It's harder to hold steady than a DSLR but that's just because of the smallness of it.  The battery seems to hold up well and is easy to recharge.  I like it!

Reviews.Title: Great camera...great price
Reviews.Author: Cristina
Reviews.Content: Love this little camera. Takes clear pics and pretty good video. Many options within the camera to adjust your pics (color saturation, different exposure settings, face retouching & etc)  For the price, you can't go wrong.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: Ian Brown "masi"
Reviews.Content: looks good, simple, and seems well constructed so you feel like you own something that is of high quality and worth. it is easy to navigate and operate. must get, and it is very affordable.

Reviews.Title: Quick and Easy
Reviews.Author: J. McDonald
Reviews.Content: First, let me say that I'm moderately clueless when it comes to any type of electronics.  I was looking for a camera that was an easy point and shoot without a lot of complicated features....I won't use them and I didn't want to pay for them.  One of the main uses for this camera will be trying to get pictures of the dogs at the animal shelter so they can be posted on our website; that's almost as tricky as getting pictures of moving children!  I originally ordered a Panasonic Lumix from another site, and while it is a perfectly nice camera, it was loaded with features and wasn't right for me.  THIS little camera, however, is absolutely perfect!  It takes relatively quick pics, and while it comes with a number of features, this camera is so self explanatory (it has a very easy to use photo guide right in the camera) that I didn't even have to read the book to get a basic sense of what it offers and how to use it (I will if I want a more detailed explanation). Overall, I couldn't be happier with this camera.  I am not intimidated with it at all :)  If you're looking for an easy to use, simple digital camera, this is the one.  It might be even more awesome than I give it credit for, but since my needs are rather simplistic, I haven't explored it in depth.  First impression, LOVE IT.

Reviews.Title: SWEET
Reviews.Author: Randy Phillips
Reviews.Content: I'm upgrading from a 5 yr old 5mp Vivatar which has been a great camera. At first I purchased a 10 mp Kodak, I luvd it cuz it was a pretty blu and really thin, unfortunately the photos wer inferior to my Vivitar. I read a review on this Samsung and the reviewer said upon opening the box he was unimpressed cuz it was so plain looking, but he gave it a high review for picture quality and features and said it was the perfect camera for a novice. That statement botherd me but hey, I am a novice, and he was obviously a SLR guy. Wen I removed mine from the box I was impressed how simple but gorgeous it is. Dull black finish in the front but a high gloss in back. The 2.7" LCD is nice and bright. I luv that it has a rechargable battery and u can use either the USB or plug it into a wall socket included for fast charging. Soon I was out in my front and back yard snapping photos and some short video clips. Its a great feature that u can just plug in the usb cable and download all ur videos and photos without removing the SD card. The photos wer spectacular even with the 5mp zoom. I cud def see the dif between my 5mp and this camera. Even the videos were way better with nice colors and sound.I was less impressed with indoor photos, however after trying dif settings I got som spectacular indoor shots. The camera is about 3/4" thick, my Vivitar was about 1 1/4" and heavy. The Samsung fits nicely in my shirt pocket, and its light. Another thing I luv about it is that it powers on quickly ready for action way faster than my Vivitar. I dont use the software, I like to just drag and drop my photos into dif folders by date or event, the PC reconizes the device immediately. I purchased a 4gig and 8gig SDHC card and I have several 1 and 2 gig. I still havnt tried out all the features but I will. My experience with digital cameras is limited but I find this unit to be a gorgeous quality high tech unit that will keep me satisfied for yrs. UPDATE: I have had this camera for 6 months now and luv it even more. The battery life is incredible and I have never ran out of juice. I have taken a few thousand photos now and am still amazed at the quality. My 8GB card I took on a 4 month vacation and took hundreds of photos and a dozen short video clips, one was 30 minutes long, and it was still not full. Being able to crop my photos onboard is really awesome.The slide show with music is nice. I have had a few blurry pics but I think its cuz Im in too big of a hurry to snap, its important to hold the shutter down half way for a half second till u hear the beep. Im really impressed w the video quality nice colors and no jerky just smooth action. I wanted to get my wife one but she likes her pretty 2 yr old 5mp kodak, But her batteries are always dead, I carry my camera around for weeks b4 charging all the while snapping many photos. I wud like to check out the Cannon but so far this little gem does it for me.UPDATE: It's been almost 4 years since I purchased this camera. It has performed flawlessly, I'm still amazed how many shots I get and videos on one charge. I have taken it on 6 trips to the Philippine Islands, it's nice the charger converts to the correct voltage. The videos are amazing, except in low light. I turn down the quality to 5 MP and even that produces exceptional photos, I always like to get the newest and ladest tech gadjet, but this camera wont go down. It's not as pretty and stylish as some of the cameras out there, but I'm completely satisfied with it.

Reviews.Title: Nice Point and Shoot
Reviews.Author: T-Rex "-Rex"
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera for my mother for Christmas.  She had an older point and shoot (Canon) that wasn't getting it done for her.  She would try to take pictures of the grand-kids and they would be gone before the picture took.  We got her this camera and it works flawlessly.  Quick pictures, convienent settings, great quality photos, rechargeable battery and charger.  Nice.  Small, yet functional, easy to set up and use.  With my mother, is has to be easy to use and not require many steps, she is not really electronics "savvy." This camera is exactly what she needs, great pricing and simple to use.  You get a nice point and shoot camera thats functional for a good price.  You want really high quality pictures with tons of options, get a SLR.  You want conveinence and good price in a small yet sturdy package, get this camera.

Reviews.Title: Good value for a point and shoot
Reviews.Author: drumlin
Reviews.Content: I combed through camera ratings and descriptions for hours and hours, and concluded that any point and shoot had drawbacks. So, since they all have just about the same complaints, why not spend as little as possible? I bought two 8 MG cards so there was no lack of space (doesn't come with any card at all, so just go ahead and buy one or two at the same time). I thought the menu was pretty intuitive, since I had previously owned a big ol' ancient Sony with just about the same menu toggle/buttony things. There is a rather frustrating delay between shots, but all the point and shoots seem to have the same problem. The pictures are fine as far as I can tell, although I haven't tried to blow them up yet. I've only had the thing a day, but so far so good. Obviously time will tell. Even if I fall out of love with it in a few months, the reality is that I've spent half of what other cameras cost, so....won't make me sob too much.

Reviews.Title: DO NOT GET IF YOU WANT QUALITY VIDEO!
Reviews.Author: Nate1star
Reviews.Content: When i got this camera, it was really easy to set up and use. The pictures are great but there is one MAJOR flaw with it that there is no info on anywhere i looked; When recording video, when you're zooming in and out, the audio (all sound) will be cut. It WILL NOT record any audio durring zooming on a video. I was very disapointed in this because when taping a performance or anything, its next to impossible to take quality video (zooming in on faces and such) while also being able to get all the audio. If you want to just take pictures its great but as for video... well you might as well throw it in the trash.

Reviews.Title: great camera!
Reviews.Author: Hannah Bananaz "fall out at my disco"
Reviews.Content: this camera worked very well when i had it! i ended up giving this to a friend a few years down the road after i bought another waterproof camera for myself. the quality was very good and i can't complain about much. it survived lots of drops and bumps. towards the end of it's time with me, the lens had a hard time opening and sometimes you'd have to manually pull them the rest of the way out, but the camera still worked well. i believe that my friend continues to use it now, years later, and it still works very well. it was a great buy and i can honestly say after all htat it went through with me i would recommend it to anyone. i enjoyed my time with it and hope my friend enjoys it as much as i do, even though it was a bit mangled when i gave it away. at least it still gets used rather than thrown out. :)

Reviews.Title: Just borrowed to use once, I am shocked!!
Reviews.Author: New Bride "trsgirl"
Reviews.Content: This thing AUTO CORRECTS any out of focus (slight) bad lighting, etc. Take shot: it shows it, then CORRECTS it.If you can still get them used for $40 GRAB IT.My Goodness, I never saw a camera < $100. do this, you need photo editing software, and spend 1/2 an hour, BLAH BLAH.How refreshing.Looks like my next camera will be Samsung.

Reviews.Title: Meh.
Reviews.Author: BeckyBlue
Reviews.Content: I got this camera because I had broken the exact same one, and I'm afraid of change, didn't want to learn a whole new device. I have to say that the shipping was much faster than I had expected it to be, but sadly, the video recorder doesn't work. It freezes the camera every time I try. It's a pretty big kick to the balls.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: Nice camera. I have this camera already. Picked this up for a friend. He liked mine so much, I was tired of him always borrowing mine.  Low cost great photos.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Kelly Larrison
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera, very easy to use and gets great pictures. My son droped my first one so i bough a newer camera that cost more money and I took that one back because it just was not even close to as good. So this is now my second one and I have had no problems with either of them. When my son dropped the first one the lense was out that is what brock, but I have dropped this camera a number of times with nothing happening, pretty tough.

Reviews.Title: Samsung 420SL
Reviews.Author: Lizzie
Reviews.Content: Frankly, I am puzzled by all the great reviews.  While I've taken some really good photos with it, I've had problems from the get go and should have returned it immediately.  1) Right now, the camera won't even open, and it is fully charged.  2) There is a long lag between photos (sometimes as long as 10 seconds), so I'm missing some great action shots.  3) I sometimes get coloring that looks like a negative; everthing faded and blue.  No matter what setting I use.  Bottom line: I will stick with a friend's advice when it comes to cameras: Nikon or Canon.  I would never recommend a Samsung.

Reviews.Title: This camera takes awful photos!!!
Reviews.Author: K. Fritzen
Reviews.Content: I will start by saying I did not purchase this camera from amazon. I purchased it in a store. I bought it after reading about how great it was. I have had the camera for over a year now & it has gradually taken worse & worse photos. I bought it originally to take closeup photo of items for my website. It doesn't like to take closeup photos. I thought at least it can take ok pictures outside. Now every outside picture is fuzzy or dark or both. I would not recommend this camera to anyone. You could buy a $50 camera that works better then this one. On a side note the video quality seems to be ok, but I wanted a camera that can take pictures!

Reviews.Title: crashing
Reviews.Author: annoyed
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for over a year now. it has good and bad aspects. it takes ok videos and pictures, its portable and has options exposure and color wise. those things are nicewhat SUCKS is you can't delete everything on the memory card by just pressing a few buttons. there is NO delete all button. you have to select EVERY photo you want deleted. if you try the easy way (deleting everything on the card through connecting it to your computer) it doesnt register this in the camera, the memory card is still filling up and acts like all that data you just deleted is still there. Reformatting the camera is the only was to get rid of that. ANNOYING i've never had a camera where you had to pick every single picture you want deleted.another problem i've been having is with transferring video from the camera to my computer. it usually works fine but it will randomly say that the file is corrupted it and it cannot transfer the video. I have lots a bunch of irreplaceable home videos because of this.Right now the camera wont even connect to my computer. i've tried about 5 times and left it plugged in for 10 mins at a time to give it a chance to work, but nothing yet.this camera after a year is starting to suck more and more...

Reviews.Title: Very Easy To Use, Quality Camera
Reviews.Author: webersrus4
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera over a year ago. It has been one of the best digital cameras I have ever owned.  It takes great pictures and is easy to use.  I have found Samsung Cameras to be alot better than some of the others.  They are well made and durable.  I will definatley buy a Samsung again in the future.

Reviews.Title: Great, with one flaw
Reviews.Author: Nathan
Reviews.Content: I'm going to keep this short and simple and say I really love the camera. The only thing I notice that is somewhat annoying is that, when you're recording video and zoom in/out, during the duration of the zooming, the audio simply cuts out. So, as long as you don't zoom in or out during your video, this is a great camera for a great price.

Reviews.Title: Love this Camera
Reviews.Author: L. Edlin
Reviews.Content: I have more elaborate digital cameras, but I always find that I grab this one because it does most everything I need and the picture quality is great.  It is very slim and easy to bring along hiking, riding bikes, skiing, or just anywhere you go.  Absolutely the only complaint I have is that it isn't the fastest to focus, so when you have someone else take a picture, often times they aren't focused if they get in a hurry.  It's not slow to focus, just not immediate.  Recently I was using this camera to video some dirt bike riding we were doing, and we had the camera on the ground while we rode through some mud.  Needless to say the camera was too close and got mud splashed all over it.  Initially I thought the camera was broken, but after blowing some compressed air around the lens area several times while turning it on and off again, the camera seems to be working just fine again.  Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: Good quality
Reviews.Author: Edgardo Pichardo "Boomz"
Reviews.Content: Very good quality item. Pictures are generally good except on low light conditions (of course). Long lasting battery and very easy to use. Reload time is acceptable but a bit faster would be excellent. Small enough to be carried in a pouch but not small enough for a shirt's pocket. Video is very good. Overall very good product.

Reviews.Title: Good Buy
Reviews.Author: Michael Z
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my girlfriend for Christmas, after an intense review process. After checking all the sites out there, I thought for her need this camera will be perfect. I was a little worried that a few people said they had problems with it not responding a few days after purchasing it. So I bought it with plenty of time to play around with it, and insure no problems will occur. I am normally a Canon user, but this camera has tons of great features. Simile detection, pre-set modes, etc. and for my girlfriends purpose, putting pictures on Facebook for her family and friend back home to see, this camera is great. The overall quality is really good for printing as well. It takes some time to learn the auto-focus for anyone who hasn't used a digital camera, but once you figure it out, it is a great buy for a new-moderate camera user. (I still love my Canons though).

Reviews.Title: Fits the purpose
Reviews.Author: Donald E. Haselwood
Reviews.Content: My wife wanted a camera to take on her trips.  It had to be small, light, not overly expensive, take good pictures, battery last for the trip and be simple to use.  She took it on a trip and came back with good pictures.  It fit the purpose just fine.

Reviews.Title: purchased as a gift
Reviews.Author: cattrelc
Reviews.Content: I don't know a whole lot about this item specifically as it was purchased as a gift for my father.  I have talked to him about it a bit and he seems quite happy with it over all.

Reviews.Title: Good camera poor documentation
Reviews.Author: Roger M. Mortensen "MM"
Reviews.Content: Got the camera a few days ago and I think I will like it. I was very frustrated with the manual though. The description on how to use the zoom button was confusing. Finally figured out though that you flick it up and down instead of pushing it. It describes the single button as if you are using 2 buttons.

Reviews.Title: nice picture, poor video
Reviews.Author: B. Malte "Nightshades"
Reviews.Content: excellent picture quality and very handy, video however is not that good due to glare in bright conditions.

ProductInfo.Features:
10.2 Megapixel delivers up to 3648 x 2736 pixels still picture resolution
5X optical zoom (5X digital) with 35mm equivalent focal length - 35-175mm
Dual Image Stabilization
Internal memory - 40 MB / External memory (recommended)
Light Sensitivity ISO 100, ISO 800, ISO 400, ISO 200, ISO 80, ISO 1600, ISO auto, ISO 3200
ProductInfo.Name: Samsung SL420 10MP Digital Camera with 5x Dual Image Stabilized Zoom and 2.7 inch LCD (Black)
